intro: Hibbertia psilocarpa, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a shrub-like appearance with alternate, ovate leaves. Hibbertia psilocarpa is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation.
